Title: The Man Trap
Summary: On planet M-113, a shape-shifting creature that craves salt infiltrates the Enterprise and preys on the crew.

Title: Charlie X
Summary: The Enterprise transports teenage castaway Charlie Evans, only to discover he wields terrifying psychic powers he cannot control.

Title: Balance of Terror
Summary: The Enterprise confronts a Romulan Bird-of-Prey testing the Federation–Romulan Neutral Zone, echoing a submarine duel in space.

Title: Beyond the Farthest Star
Summary: The animated Enterprise encounters a derelict ancient starship and a malevolent entity seeking escape from a dead star.

Title: Yesteryear
Summary: Spock must travel back into his own childhood on Vulcan to correct a timeline where he died as a boy.

Title: The Lorelei Signal
Summary: The women of the Enterprise must rescue the male crew from siren-like aliens draining their life-force.

Title: Encounter at Farpoint
Summary: The new Enterprise-D faces judgment from Q while investigating the mysterious Farpoint Station.

Title: The Best of Both Worlds, Part I
Summary: Picard is captured and assimilated by the Borg, leaving Riker to face an impossible tactical choice.

Title: The Inner Light
Summary: A probe causes Picard to live an entire lifetime in minutes as a man on a long-dead world.

Title: Emissary
Summary: Commander Sisko takes command of Deep Space 9 and encounters the Bajoran Prophets inside the Celestial Temple.

Title: Duet
Summary: Kira confronts a Cardassian who may have been a notorious war criminal from the Bajoran occupation.

Title: The Visitor
Summary: An accident seemingly kills Sisko, but Jake spends a lifetime trying to bring his father back from subspace.

Title: Caretaker
Summary: Voyager is stranded in the Delta Quadrant while investigating a powerful entity known as the Caretaker.

Title: Year of Hell, Part I
Summary: An alien with a temporal weapon ship relentlessly attacks Voyager, erasing people and events from history.

Title: Blink of an Eye
Summary: Voyager becomes trapped above a planet where time passes far more quickly on the surface than in orbit.

Title: Broken Bow
Summary: Captain Archer takes Enterprise NX-01 on its first mission amid tensions with the Klingon Empire and the Temporal Cold War.

Title: Shockwave, Part I
Summary: A disastrous accident threatens to cancel the Enterprise mission as Archer is drawn deeper into the Temporal Cold War.

Title: Twilight
Summary: A temporal parasite leaves Archer unable to form new memories while Earth faces destruction by the Xindi.

Title: The Vulcan Hello
Summary: First Officer Michael Burnham’s actions during a tense encounter with the Klingons ignite a devastating war.

Title: Magic to Make the Sanest Man Go Mad
Summary: Mudd traps Discovery in a deadly time loop, repeatedly killing the crew to learn the ship’s secrets.

Title: Such Sweet Sorrow, Part 2
Summary: Discovery travels through a wormhole to the far future to save all sentient life from Control.

Title: Remembrance
Summary: Retired Admiral Picard meets a mysterious young woman linked to Data and uncovers a conspiracy on Earth.

Title: Nepenthe
Summary: Picard and Soji seek refuge with Riker and Troi on the world of Nepenthe while pursued by Romulans.

Title: No Win Scenario
Summary: Picard and his former crew confront a seemingly hopeless situation aboard the Titan, echoing the Kobayashi Maru.

Title: Strange New Worlds
Summary: Captain Pike returns to command the Enterprise and answers a distress call from a first-contact mission gone wrong.

Title: A Quality of Mercy
Summary: Pike confronts his fate when shown an alternate timeline version of the classic Romulan encounter from TOS.

Title: Tomorrow and Tomorrow and Tomorrow
Summary: La’An is pulled into an altered timeline and must work with a younger Kirk to protect the Federation’s future.

Title: Second Contact
Summary: The Lower Decks ensigns of the Cerritos juggle personal chaos while supporting a routine second-contact mission.

Title: Crisis Point
Summary: Mariner turns a holodeck movie into therapeutic revenge fantasy targeting her mother, Captain Freeman.

Title: wej Duj
Summary: Parallel lower-decks crews on Starfleet, Klingon, and Vulcan ships all play roles in a looming threat.

Title: Lost & Found, Part I
Summary: Young prisoners on Tars Lamora discover a derelict Federation starship and escape into the stars.

Title: Kobayashi
Summary: Dal runs the Kobayashi Maru holodeck scenario with legendary Starfleet officers to learn what it means to be a captain.

Title: Supernova, Part 2
Summary: The Protostar crew makes a desperate sacrifice to stop a weapon that could tear Starfleet apart.
